title: 407-E
statement: E. k-d-sequencetime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutWe'll call a sequence of integers a goodk-dsequence if we can add to it at mostknumbers in such a way that after the sorting the sequence will be an arithmetic progression with differenced.You got hold of some sequencea, consisting ofnintegers. Your task is to find its longest contiguous subsegment, such that it is a goodk-dsequence.InputThe first line contains three space-separated integersn,k,d(1 ≤n≤ 2·105; 0 ≤k≤ 2·105; 0 ≤d≤ 109). The second line containsnspace-separated integers:a1,a2, ...,an(- 109≤ai≤ 109) — the actual sequence.OutputPrint two space-separated integersl,r(1 ≤l≤r≤n) show that sequenceal,al+ 1, ...,aris the longest subsegment that is a goodk-dsequence.If there are multiple optimal answers, print the one with the minimum value ofl.ExamplesInput6 1 24 3 2 8 6 2Output3 5NoteIn the first test sample the answer is the subsegment consisting of numbers 2, 8, 6 — after adding number 4 and sorting it becomes sequence 2, 4, 6, 8 — the arithmetic progression with difference 2.
